intro: Hoffmannseggella adelinae, commonly known as the Adelinae lichen, is a foliose lichen that thrives in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Parmeliaceae and is characterized by its leathery, crust-like thallus. The lichen forms a symbiotic relationship between a photosynthetic alga and a fungal partner, enabling it to absorb nutrients from the environment. It is typically found on bark, rocks, and soil in temperate regions. Its slow growth and unique morphology make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
